snippet: Battles between the Syrian military and rebels burst a main pipe that delivered drinking water to hundreds of thousands of residents of Aleppo, opposition groups said Saturday.
abstract: Opposition groups report that clashes between Syrian military and rebel fighters burst a main pipe that delivers drinking water to hundreds of thousands of residents of Aleppo; United Nations refugee agency says more than 1.2 million Syrians still inside the country, half of them children, had been displaced from their homes.

byline.original: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and HALA DROUBI
byline.contributor: David D. Kirkpatrick reported from Beirut, and Hala Droubi from Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

lead_paragraph: Battles between the Syrian military and rebels burst a main pipe that delivered drinking water to hundreds of thousands of residents of Aleppo, opposition groups said Saturday.
